climbs.name: Walking the Plank
climbs.fa: Eric Clark, Ashley Tucker, JS, July 2018

content.description: This line rivals any of the 5.10 trad routes accessed from the Challenge Buttress parking area. Climb past two bolts to a series of three bulges, protected by gear, then make a short traverse left to a good stance and another bolt. Continue straight-up, juking as necessary to get good gear (requires some scrutiny), to chains.
content.protection: Double set of cams from micro to 2.5 inches will ensure you have what you need when you want it. Lower or rap from chains.
content.location:
About 20 feet upslope (right) of

More than a Feeling

. Look for non-painted Fixe hangers up and right of a small tree about 15 feet off the deck.

climbs.name: Safety Check
climbs.fa: Carl Dec, John Lemnotis, Mitch Moline

content.description: Route climbs bolt to bolt passing block on right. Crux is the face climbing above block. Thin feet and hidden side pulls make this section! Route shares anchor with Let Her Rip, for now.
content.protection: 12 bolts. Shares anchor with Let Her Rip, for now.
content.location: Just right of Let Her Rip

content.description:
More Than a Feeling

is the best sport route on Disciple Ridge, although it might not look it from the ground. It is well worth the walk. The first 6 or so bolts protect steep but somewhat broken rock into a short right-facing dihedral and a good ledge to the left. Above is a flatish, nearly vertical wall, with another 7 or 8 bolts protecting interesting and unusual climbing to chains.
content.protection: Sixteen draws should do it. To lower, you should have a 70 meter rope. A rap is possible with a 60m rope.
content.location: If you approach as recommended (via Vector Madness Wall), it’ll deposit you within 25 or so feet of the base of the route. Look for the line of bolts, left of small tree growing out of the rock maybe 10 feet up.

content.description:
This starts as a fine short sport climbing pitch on generally good rock then degenerates into a mostly bolted pitch over chossy ground and then a full-trad pitch over similarly broken terrain. (1) Clip bolts and juke your way up a blunt arête to a decent ledge and chains – worth doing as a warm-up for

More than a Feeling

and

Walking the Plank

upslope. (5.8, 50 feet.) (2) Continue clipping bolts, trending left when it doubt, to another set of chains. (5.6, 80 feet.) (3) We worked back right past a gully system to a steeper crack system that ended in the vicinity of a huge but somewhat sloppy ledge, but the Calderone guide shows the route as climbing the gully system to the top of Disciple Ridge.  In either case, the pitch ends at chain anchors. (5.6, at least 100 feet.)
content.protection: Single set of cams, a dozen draws, and some shoulder-length slings. To descend, plan on two or three rappels from chains; don’t pass up any stations if in doubt.
content.location:
Lift Up Your Face

is the probably the first bolted route you’ll encounter if approached viea the East Face of Challenge Buttress and Vector Madness Wall.  See beta photograph.

content.description: The route can be started by climbing straight at the pin or by climbing left facing corner (more secure) to same pin. It then follows a shallow right facing corner passing a roof on the left and then following corner/crack to the top.
content.protection: 1 pin, 1 bolt and a standard rack will get you to the chains.
content.location: Roughly 50' uphill from Walking the Plank and just left of Safety Check. Look for a pin that is the 1st piece.
